definition[0]: to be similar to another idea, statement etc, so that they seem to be true
example[0]: Her description tied in with that of the other witness.
definition[1]: to be related in some way to something else
example[1]: How does all this tie in with their long-term aims?
definition[2]: to happen at the same time as something else
example[2]: The book was published to tie in with the TV series.
